abstract: Google disclosed in its 2006 annual report on Thursday that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission nearly a year ago had called into question how it accounted for income taxes. In the annual filing, Google said it received a letter from the S.E.C. in March 2006 on various issues and subsequently corresponded with the agency as recently as January 2007. The tax dispute remains unresolved.
lead_paragraph: Google disclosed in its 2006 annual report on Thursday that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission nearly a year ago had called into question how it accounted for income taxes. In the annual filing, Google said it received a letter from the S.E.C. in March 2006 on various issues and subsequently corresponded with the agency as recently as January 2007. The tax dispute remains unresolved.

headline.main: S.E.C. Takes Issue With Google Tax Accounting
